metadata.title: CVE-2021-47244 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mptcp: Fix out of bounds when parsing TCP optionsThe TCP option parser in mptcp (mptcp_get_options) could read one byteout of bounds. When the length is 1, the execution flow gets into theloop, reads one byte of the opcode, and if the opcode is neitherTCPOPT_EOL nor TCPOPT_NOP, it reads one more byte, which exceeds thelength of 1.This fix is inspired by commit 9609dad263f8 ("ipv4: tcp_input: fix stackout of bounds when parsing TCP options.").
